options.title: -f encoding, --from-code=encoding
options.description: Specifies the encoding of the input.

options.title: -f encoding, --from-code=encoding
options.description: Specifies the encoding of the input.

options.title: -t encoding, --to-code=encoding
options.description: Specifies the encoding of the output.

options.title: -t encoding, --to-code=encoding
options.description: Specifies the encoding of the output.

options.title: -c
options.description: When this option is given, characters that cannot be converted are silently discarded, instead of leading to a conversion error.

options.title: --unicode-subst=formatstring
options.description: When this option is given, Unicode characters that cannot be represented in the target encoding are replaced with a placeholder string that is constructed from the given formatstring, applied to the Unicode code point. The formatstring must be a format string in the same format as for the printf command or the printf() function, taking either no argument or exactly one unsigned integer argument.

options.title: --byte-subst=formatstring
options.description: When this option is given, bytes in the input that are not valid in the source encoding are replaced with a placeholder string that is constructed from the given formatstring, applied to the byte's value. The formatstring must be a format string in the same format as for the printf command or the printf() function, taking either no argument or exactly one unsigned integer argument.

options.title: --widechar-subst=formatstring
options.description: When this option is given, wide characters in the input that are not valid in the source encoding are replaced with a placeholder string that is constructed from the given formatstring, applied to the byte's value. The formatstring must be a format string in the same format as for the printf command or the printf() function, taking either no argument or exactly one unsigned integer argument.

options.title: -s, --silent
options.description: When this option is given, error messages about invalid or unconvertible characters are omitted, but the actual converted text is unaffected.

options.title: -s, --silent
options.description: When this option is given, error messages about invalid or unconvertible characters are omitted, but the actual converted text is unaffected.
